Reviews.Content: Danger Beware- Never Stay At The Byron Hotel!!! No amount of money is worth a stay at this hotel.I have traveled with student groups for many years, and the Byron Hotel is absolutely the worst hotel that I have ever visited.Water was literally pouring in the rooms from the ceiling above.Dank musty odors filled the rooms and hallways.Rude female staff member was unpleasant to all.Breakfast food was mediocre at best.
Reviews.Author: junebug1955

Reviews.Content: NEVER come back! It was a terrible experience! Durty, old, ugly, stinky, small and such a cold place to stay! Plus unfriendly staff and far NOT fresh breakfast (with a smelly ham!!!), also located next to the loud bar that works all night long! And ALL THESE for such a high price!?!?!?! We loved Florence but the place spoiled all our experience thus i HIGHLY recommend you to stay somewhere else. Good luck!
Reviews.Author: Tatralfiana

Reviews.Content: Awful This hotel is awful........do not stay here!! The staff were rude and unhelpful, the rooms tiny and dirty and our double bed was two extremely uncomfortable camper beds pushed together! The bathroom was the tiniest ive ever seen. A complete waste of money. I would strongly advise anyone looking for a hotel in florence not to stay here as it will ruin your holiday. Luckily my boyfriend and i were able to find a much nicer and cheaper hotel nearby that could accomodate us for the remainder of our stay.
Reviews.Author: shirleyroo

Reviews.Content: OK if back room, but not a 3 star place Stayed here for one night on April 11th. Hotel was centrally located about 50 metres from the main station and about a 8 minute walk to the main 'tourist' area. Positives: Hotel was clean and price I paid for a double was very good (much less than what they quote on their web page). Staff were pleasant, and there was a pc with free internet connectionRoom is large with high ceilingsNegatives: Is in a noisy location, so you should ask for a room at the back if you want to be able to sleep (i had this, and it was fine). Breakfast was very average, and beds were extremely soft (I had 3 singles beds in the room, and one was not possible to sleep in due to the springs). Also like most hotels in italy, you hear the toilet and shower of the other rooms, and the people walking around. Overall: If you are looking for a cheap centrally located hotel then this will do you, if though you want luxury etc, I would not suggest this.
Reviews.Author: JenM72

Reviews.Content: 2 star hotel, not 3 We stayed here from the 24-27th Sept. 2006. our room was on the 3rd floor, luckily not overlooking the street, which is busy all day  night.It's located near the station in quite a seedy place, popular with immigrants.It only deserves 2 stars. It probably got 3 stars based on the facilities it offers, which are listed on its website but please read my comments for each entry:TV color SAT - 17 inch screen, very small  very few channelsFrigobar - meaning empty fridge (not at all a 鈥渨ell-equipped mini-bar鈥?as stated on their welcome page)Direct dial Telephone - but no phone instructions, not even front desk's numberFree email receiving service - I have no idea what this meansHairdryer / Cosmetic mirror - mirror with 2 great big cracks through itKettle - 4 sachets of sugar  2 of instant coffee, which are never replenishedOpenable window - to let in the mosquitoes  pigeonsPrivate facilities 鈥?again, I have no idea what this meansAir-conditioned - huge air conditioner fitted on the wall, which is so noisy it keeps you awake when on. Same thing with the ceiling fan.The breakfast consists of: Pre-packaged brioche/croissantsTea  coffee (the coffee tasted awful and strange)A plate with sliced processed cheese (one type only) and another plate with processed cold meat (also only one type) A selection of yoghurts, which were warmCereals: 2 dispensers, both filled with corn flakes! An apple pie that tasted home baked and was deliciousFresh juices: grapefruit juice and a mixed fruit juice that was reddish in colour and was too acidic to drinkThe breakfast room was small and had too many tables.The only toiletries in the bathroom are: Toilet paperFacial tissues2 x sachets of all-in-one shampoo/shower gel2 x small bars of soapThe shower curtain was too long and we ended up standing on it while showering. Whatever we did, water still managed to seep onto the bathroom floor.Our shower wasn鈥檛 working properly, the hand basin was blocked and the pillows were old and flat. We reported this to the front desk and it was dealt with very promptly.The bidet never worked, but we forgot to report it!On our last night, guests in a room adjacent to ours decided to play their TV at full blast at 3am, waking us up. We called front desk and nothing was done about it. Eventually, we had to go and deal with the guests ourselves. It was not nice, especially as they were on drugs, but they did quieten down. The hotel rack rate is 鈧?80 single and 鈧?20 double but I wouldn鈥檛 pay more than 鈧?0 per room to stay here. I鈥檓 Italian myself and I鈥檓 sad to say that this hotel casts a very negative light on Italian hospitality.We'll never stay here again.
Reviews.Author: NMRK

Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Travellers beware! I just returned from our honeymoon in italy and we had the displeasure of staying at hotel byron for 2 nights. The hotel had mosquitos everywhere, needless to say it was not a pleasant stay. Later to our knowledge, after arrriving in Rome, we had bites that turned out to be bed bug bites!!!! Disgusting and horrible. Just wanted to save everyone the hassle of ever booking with this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Awful Hotel I stayed there in last May and this hotel was quite dirty, dark and noisy. I need to wear my shoe in the room and put the towel onto the bedsheet. It can't be categorizd as a Hotel, but a dorm. Just like summer campus but not a travel trip. Don't stay there and it costed me 110Euro, it was the most expensive hotel when i stayed in Europe, however the worst enviroment and service.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ceepy and Terrible! The official website claims this is a 3.5 star hotel... do NOT listen to that!! I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in many many places in this world, but never have I seen such a disgusting hotel as the Byron Hotel Firenze! We were on the ground floor, and I stayed with two other college girls and we felt scared and unsafe being anywhere besided locked in our room as night came near. The room is tall and hollow and basically a cement chamber! Maybe this creepy hotel had some influence upon my overall impression of Florence, but overall I was not impressed and don't wish to return. If you go to Florence make sure you do NOT stay here unless you want to hear the street noises and feel like you're in a dungeon! We could not wait to get out of this hotel and return to America!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a 3 star hotel My daughter, two granddaughters and I spent 5 nights in March 2004. We had a quad room that was roomy but was located on the street side and it was noisy. The hotel caters to teenage tour groups that are noisy and fill the breakfast room in the morning. The locations is good but the hotel is showing its age. Some of the staff is very helpful but some can be rude.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: As good as a college dorm at best! Three of stayed here one night (March 2004) in a dorm-like room: dark, cold, and narrow, with indoor/outdoor carpeting, hard beds and a cramped bathroom that had a shower (no stall) flowing right into the sink and toilet. It was by far the worst place we stayed in Italy. We were told later that it is used by mainly tour groups catering to teenagers. One night for us was plenty! There must be a better place to stay in Florence - keep looking!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It was OK I was quite happy with this hotel. After a week's worth of travelling with 15 teenagers who had travelled from Australia, i could not fault the service. Very close to the centre of Florence, railway station no more than a block away, and a superb and cosy restaurant 2 doors down.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrible I stayed here in March 2001. Towels were not changed, the breakfast area was small and very limited, the carabinieri academy is across the is across the street and the cadets are constantly looking into your rooms and yelling at the females
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointed I stay here for one night, my room was on the ground floor. The carpet is really bad. TV is not working/no antenna. Breakfast is good. Hotel staff is very helpfull. Hotel location is very close to central train station. I was hoping to get nice hotel since I pay more than $100 a night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
